inkball

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
    a ball object, have every function a ball should have.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String color
      color of ball
      java.lang.String colorIndex
      corresponding color idx of ball, for example, grey's color idx is 0.
      float radius
      radius of ball
      boolean ready
      Indicate a ball need to move from right of loading zone to the left, each ball can be load from right to left once.
      float x
      x coordinate of ball center
      float x_velocity
      speed of ball
      float y
      y coordinate of ball center
      float y_velocity
      speed of ball

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ballMove()
      update the ball's coordinate with its velocity
      void boundaryCollisionCheck()
      check whether ball collide with boundary, it it does, change its speed and direction correctly
      void checkCollision(App app)
      check whether ball collide with bouncy object, namely, use boundaryCollisionCheck(), wallCollisionCheck(), and lineCollisionCheck() to implement.
      boolean checkCollisionHelper(float p1x, float p1y, float p2x, float p2y, int episilon)
      check if ball collide with a line, the difference between this one and checkLineCollisionHelper() is that we need not to consider about the thickness of line
      Ball checkEnterHole(Level level, App a)
      check whether ball inside hole attraction cycle; if yes, then apply attraction force to the ball; if ball enter the hole, the scorer should get correspond score
      boolean checkLineCollisionHelper(float p1x, float p1y, float p2x, float p2y)
      check if ball collide with a line, the difference between this one and checkCollisionHelper() is that we need to consider about the thickness of line
      void lineCollisionCheck(App app)
      if collide with a line, the line will be removed, and ball will bounce.
      float[] normalVectorHelper(float p1x, float p1y, float p2x, float p2y)
      calculate the normal vector of given line which composed of point 1 and 2
      void updateColor(java.lang.String color)
      update color and color index of ball
      void updateVelocity(float xv, float yv)
      update velocity of ball
      void wallCollisionCheck()
      if collide with a wall, the wall will break when ball's color equals wall's color or ball color is grey or ball color is grey

      • checkEnterHole

        public Ball checkEnterHole(Level level,
                           App a)
        check whether ball inside hole attraction cycle; if yes, then apply attraction force to the ball; if ball enter the hole, the scorer should get correspond score
        Parameters:
        level - current level class
        a - App class
        Returns:
        return ball if ball enter the hole, null otherwise.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision(App app)
        check whether ball collide with bouncy object, namely, use boundaryCollisionCheck(), wallCollisionCheck(), and lineCollisionCheck() to implement.
        Parameters:
        app - class instance we used for the game

      • boundaryCollisionCheck

        public void boundaryCollisionCheck()
        check whether ball collide with boundary, it it does, change its speed and direction correctly

      • wallCollisionCheck

        public void wallCollisionCheck()
        if collide with a wall, the wall will break when ball's color equals wall's color or ball color is grey or ball color is grey

      • lineCollisionCheck

        public void lineCollisionCheck(App app)
        if collide with a line, the line will be removed, and ball will bounce.
        Parameters:
        app - instance we used for the game

      • checkCollisionHelper

        public boolean checkCollisionHelper(float p1x,
                                    float p1y,
                                    float p2x,
                                    float p2y,
                                    int episilon)
        check if ball collide with a line, the difference between this one and checkLineCollisionHelper() is that we need not to consider about the thickness of line
        Parameters:
        p1x - x of one endpoint
        p1y - y of one endpoint
        p2x - x of another endpoint
        p2y - y of another endpoint
        episilon - the scaler we add to judge the touch condition.
        Returns:
        return true if collide, false otherwise

      • checkLineCollisionHelper

        public boolean checkLineCollisionHelper(float p1x,
                                        float p1y,
                                        float p2x,
                                        float p2y)
        check if ball collide with a line, the difference between this one and checkCollisionHelper() is that we need to consider about the thickness of line
        Parameters:
        p1x - x of one endpoint
        p1y - y of one endpoint
        p2x - x of another endpoint
        p2y - y of another endpoint
        Returns:
        return true if collide, false otherwise

      • normalVectorHelper

        public float[] normalVectorHelper(float p1x,
                                  float p1y,
                                  float p2x,
                                  float p2y)
        calculate the normal vector of given line which composed of point 1 and 2
        Parameters:
        p1x - point 1 x
        p1y - point 1 y
        p2x - point 2 x
        p2y - point 2 y
        Returns:
        The normal vector of the line closer to the ball
